meta.title: From UNLEAVENED to BREAD
meta.author: Sandy Weisz
meta.message: During Passover we eat matzah, which is made by mixing flour and water and baking quickly before any natural fermentation can occur. It commemorates the Exodus from Egypt when fleeing Jews had no time to let dough rise. There's no better daytime snack that a piece of matzah with a spread of salted butter. ðŸ¤¤
